reply: Purrr. Yellow and green are both colors in the visible light spectrum, but they differ in their wavelengths and how our eyes perceive them. Yellow has a longer wavelength than green and is often associated with brightness and warmth. Green, on the other hand, has a shorter wavelength than yellow and is commonly linked to nature and freshness. In terms of color mixing, green is typically created by combining yellow and blue. Purrr.
